# Template: Particulars of Claim Skeleton

<!-- This template provides frameworks for drafting Particulars of Claim in various contentious probate claims -->

## Usage Instructions

**Purpose:** To draft Particulars of Claim compliant with CPR requirements  
**When to use:** When commencing contentious probate proceedings  
**Important:** Plead material facts, not evidence. Ensure all elements of cause of action are pleaded. Customize for specific claim type and facts.

---

## General Format and Requirements

### Heading

```
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUSTICE
CHANCERY DIVISION
[SPECIFY DISTRICT REGISTRY IF APPLICABLE]

CLAIM NO: [To be allocated by court]

BETWEEN:

[CLAIMANT NAME(S)]
                                                           Claimant(s)
-and-

[DEFENDANT NAME(S)]
                                                           Defendant(s)
```

### Title

**PARTICULARS OF CLAIM**

---

## Template A: Lack of Testamentary Capacity

### Parties

1. The Claimant is [describe relationship to deceased - e.g., "the daughter of the deceased" / "a beneficiary under an earlier will dated [date]"] and [brings this claim in a representative capacity on behalf of all persons interested in the estate pursuant to CPR 19.7A / brings this claim in [his/her] personal capacity].

2. The [First] Defendant is [describe - e.g., "the executor named in the purported will dated [date]" / "a beneficiary under the purported will"].

3. [Continue for all defendants]

### Background

4. [Full name of deceased] ("the Deceased") died on [date of death] [domiciled in England and Wales / aged [X] years].

5. [If relevant: The Deceased was [briefly describe deceased - e.g., occupation, family circumstances relevant to dispute].]

### The Purported Will

6. On [date], the Deceased purportedly executed a document purporting to be [his/her] last will and testament ("the 2[XX] Will").

7. The 2[XX] Will was [prepared by [name of solicitor/firm] / prepared by [describe circumstances if homemade]] and purportedly executed at [location].

8. The attesting witnesses to the 2[XX] Will were [names if known/relevant].

9. The 2[XX] Will appoints [name(s)] as executor(s) and [briefly summarize key provisions relevant to claim].

10. [If relevant: On [date], a grant of probate was issued to [name(s)] in respect of the 2[XX] Will.]

### Earlier Will(s) [If applicable]

11. On [date], the Deceased executed a will ("the 2[XX] Will") which [describe relevant provisions and contrast with disputed will].

12. [If multiple wills: Continue detailing earlier wills chronologically]

### The Deceased's Capacity

13. At the time of the purported execution of the 2[XX] Will, the Deceased lacked testamentary capacity.

**PARTICULARS OF LACK OF CAPACITY**

(a) The Deceased [suffered from / was suffering from] [specify medical condition - e.g., vascular dementia / Alzheimer's disease / severe depression].

(b) By reason of [his/her] condition, the Deceased was unable to:
    (i) understand the nature of making a will and its effects;
    (ii) comprehend and appreciate the extent of [his/her] property;
    (iii) comprehend and appreciate the claims to which [he/she] ought to give effect; and/or
    (iv) appreciate the effect of the dispositions made in the 2[XX] Will.

(c) [If relevant: The Deceased was subject to an insane delusion that [describe delusion] which affected the dispositions in the 2[XX] Will.]

(d) [The Deceased's mental state is evidenced by [briefly list key evidence - medical records, witness observations, etc.].]

14. The test for testamentary capacity is as set out in *Banks v Goodfellow* (1870) LR 5 QB 549.

15. The Deceased did not satisfy the test in *Banks v Goodfellow* at the time of execution of the 2[XX] Will.

### [If relevant: Suspicious Circumstances]

16. Further or alternatively, there were suspicious circumstances surrounding the execution of the 2[XX] Will, namely:

**PARTICULARS OF SUSPICIOUS CIRCUMSTANCES**

(a) [The Deceased was [elderly and infirm / seriously ill / mentally impaired] at the time.]
(b) [The 2[XX] Will was prepared by [beneficiary or person closely connected to beneficiary].]
(c) [The 2[XX] Will made unexpected provisions benefiting [name].]
(d) [The 2[XX] Will was executed [shortly before death / during a period of known incapacity].]
(e) [The Deceased received no independent legal advice.]
(f) [Further particulars may be provided after disclosure.]

### Relief Sought

17. In the premises, the Claimant seeks:

(1) A declaration that the 2[XX] Will is invalid and should not be admitted to probate;

(2) [A declaration that the 2[XX] Will dated [date] is the last valid will of the Deceased / A declaration that the Deceased died intestate];

(3) [An order that the grant of probate dated [date] be revoked];

(4) [Such further or other relief as the Court thinks fit];

(5) Costs;

(6) Interest pursuant to section 35A of the Senior Courts Act 1981.

---

## Template B: Undue Influence

### [Parties and Background sections similar to Template A]

### The Purported Will [Similar to Template A]

### Undue Influence

13. The 2[XX] Will was procured by the undue influence of [name of alleged influencer] ("the Influencer").

14. The Influencer was [describe relationship - e.g., the Deceased's [son/daughter/carer/friend] and a substantial beneficiary under the 2[XX] Will].

**PARTICULARS OF UNDUE INFLUENCE**

(a) At the relevant time, the Deceased was [elderly / infirm / vulnerable / isolated / dependent on the Influencer for [care/support/etc.]].

(b) The Influencer [describe acts of coercion/pressure]:
    (i) [E.g., isolated the Deceased from other family members];
    (ii) [E.g., controlled the Deceased's finances and access to legal advice];
    (iii) [E.g., made threats that [specify]];
    (iv) [E.g., exerted emotional pressure by [specify]].

(c) The 2[XX] Will contains provisions substantially benefiting the Influencer which:
    (i) are inconsistent with the Deceased's earlier testamentary intentions;
    (ii) are contrary to the natural expectations and moral obligations of the Deceased;
    (iii) can only be explained by the undue influence exerted by the Influencer.

(d) [The 2[XX] Will was prepared at the instance/direction of the Influencer.]

(e) [The Deceased executed the 2[XX] Will in the presence of/at the direction of the Influencer.]

(f) [The Deceased expressed [reluctance/unwillingness] to make the provisions in the 2[XX] Will but did so because of the pressure from the Influencer.]

15. The 2[XX] Will does not represent the free and voluntary wishes of the Deceased but is the product of coercion amounting to undue influence as defined in *Hall v Hall* (1868) LR 1 P&D 481.

### Relief Sought [Similar to Template A]

---

## Template C: Inheritance Act Claim

### Parties

1. The Claimant is [describe relationship and establish eligible claimant status under s.1(1) - e.g., "the surviving spouse/civil partner of the deceased" / "a child of the deceased" / "a person treated by the deceased as a child of the family" / "a person maintained by the deceased"].

2. The Defendant is [the executor/personal representative of the estate].

### The Deceased and Death

3. [Full name] ("the Deceased") died on [date] [aged [X] years] [domiciled in England and Wales].

4. Probate of the Deceased's will dated [date] was granted to the Defendant on [date].

5. [OR: Letters of administration of the Deceased's estate were granted to the Defendant on [date] as the Deceased died intestate.]

### The Will/Intestacy

6. Under the Deceased's will dated [date] [OR: under the intestacy rules], the Deceased's estate is to be distributed [describe distribution].

7. Under the will [OR: under the intestacy], the Claimant [receives [specify provision] / receives no provision].

### The Estate

8. The gross value of the Deceased's estate is approximately £[amount].

9. The net value of the estate after payment of debts, liabilities and inheritance tax is approximately £[amount].

**PARTICULARS OF ESTATE ASSETS**

(a) [Property at [address] valued at approximately £[amount]]
(b) [Bank and savings accounts totaling approximately £[amount]]
(c) [Investment portfolio valued at approximately £[amount]]
(d) [Personal chattels valued at approximately £[amount]]
(e) [Other assets: [specify]]

[Further particulars will be provided after disclosure of estate accounts.]

### Eligible Claimant Status

10. The Claimant is an eligible applicant under section 1(1)([specify subsection]) of the Inheritance (Provision for Family and Dependants) Act 1975 ("the 1975 Act") because [he/she] is [specify category and establish qualifying relationship].

**PARTICULARS**

[Provide particulars establishing eligible claimant status - e.g., for spouse/child: marriage certificate/birth certificate details; for dependant: details of maintenance provided]

### Reasonable Financial Provision

11. The provision made for the Claimant under the will [OR: on intestacy] is not reasonable financial provision within the meaning of section 1(2) of the 1975 Act.

12. The Claimant is entitled to [provision for maintenance / such financial provision as would be reasonable in all the circumstances] [depending on claimant category].

### Section 3 Matters

13. In determining what provision should be made, the Court is required to consider the matters set out in section 3 of the 1975 Act, namely:

**PARTICULARS**

**(a) Financial resources and needs of the Claimant:**

[Provide full particulars of claimant's financial position:]
- Income: £[amount] per [month/year] from [sources]
- Capital: £[amount] comprising [assets]
- Outgoings: £[amount] per [month/year] comprising [breakdown]
- Housing: [owns/rents/lives with others - details]
- Health: [any relevant health issues affecting needs]
- [Claimant's earning capacity and employment prospects]
- [Any other relevant financial needs]

**(b) Financial resources and needs of beneficiaries:**

[Provide particulars if known, subject to disclosure:]
- [To the best of the Claimant's knowledge, [beneficiary name] has [describe resources/needs]]
- [Further particulars will be provided after disclosure]

**(c) Obligations and responsibilities of the Deceased:**

- [The Deceased was the Claimant's [husband/wife/father/mother/etc.] and had a moral and/or legal obligation to provide for the Claimant]
- [The Claimant was financially dependent on the Deceased who provided [describe support]]
- [The Claimant [cared for/supported] the Deceased for [X] years]
- [Further particulars: [specify]]

**(d) Size and nature of the estate:**

- The estate is valued at approximately £[amount] net
- The estate comprises primarily [describe nature - e.g., family home, liquid assets, etc.]

**(e) Physical or mental disability:**

- [The Claimant suffers from [condition] which [affects earning capacity/creates additional needs/etc.]]
- [OR: Neither the Claimant nor any beneficiary has a relevant disability]

**(f) Any other relevant matter:**

- [The Claimant [gave up career/employment/education] to [care for deceased/raise children/etc.]]
- [The Deceased promised to provide for the Claimant]
- [The Claimant made financial contributions to [property/deceased's welfare/etc.]]
- [Further matters: [specify]]

**[If spouse/civil partner - additional s.3(2) matters:]**

**(g) Age and duration of marriage:**

- The Claimant and Deceased married on [date] and the marriage lasted [X] years until the Deceased's death
- [The Claimant is now aged [X]]

**(h) Contribution to the welfare of the family:**

- [During the marriage, the Claimant [describe contributions - e.g., raised children, supported deceased's career, managed household, etc.]]
- [The Claimant contributed financially by [specify]]

### Provision Sought

14. The Claimant seeks an order that reasonable financial provision be made for [him/her] out of the Deceased's estate.

15. The Claimant will contend that reasonable provision requires:

**PARTICULARS OF PROVISION SOUGHT**

(a) [A lump sum payment of £[amount] to enable the Claimant to [specify purpose - e.g., purchase accommodation, provide capital to generate income, etc.]]

(b) [OR/AND: Periodical payments of £[amount] per [month/year] for [life/specified period]]

(c) [OR/AND: Transfer of [property/specific asset] to the Claimant]

(d) [Such provision is reasonable having regard to the matters set out in section 3 because [briefly explain]]

### Relief Sought

16. The Claimant seeks:

(1) An order pursuant to section 2 of the 1975 Act that reasonable financial provision be made for the Claimant out of the Deceased's estate, namely:
    [Specify relief sought - lump sum/periodical payments/property transfer]

(2) [If appropriate: An interim order pursuant to section 5 of the 1975 Act for immediate payment of £[amount] for [claimant's maintenance pending determination]]

(3) Such further or other relief as the Court thinks fit;

(4) Costs;

(5) Interest pursuant to section 35A of the Senior Courts Act 1981.

---

## Template D: Executor Misconduct

### [Parties section similar to above]

### The Estate and Appointment

4. [Full name] ("the Deceased") died on [date].

5. The Deceased's will dated [date] appointed the Defendant as [sole executor / one of the executors].

6. Probate was granted to the Defendant on [date].

7. The Claimant is a beneficiary under the will, entitled to [specify entitlement].

### The Defendant's Duties

8. As executor, the Defendant owes fiduciary duties to the estate and its beneficiaries, including:

(a) A duty to collect and get in the estate;
(b) A duty to administer the estate in accordance with the will and the law;
(c) A duty to act with due diligence;
(d) A duty to account;
(e) A duty to act impartially between beneficiaries;
(f) A duty to avoid conflicts of interest;
(g) A duty not to profit from the trust.

### Breach of Duty

9. The Defendant has breached [his/her] duties as executor.

**PARTICULARS OF BREACH**

(a) [The Defendant has failed to collect in estate assets, namely [specify]]

(b) [The Defendant has improperly distributed £[amount] to [himself/herself / specify] without authority]

(c) [The Defendant has sold estate assets at an undervalue to [himself/herself/connected party], namely [specify asset, price, market value]]

(d) [The Defendant has delayed unreasonably in administering the estate for [X] years without justification]

(e) [The Defendant has failed to account despite requests dated [dates]]

(f) [The Defendant has incurred excessive costs of £[amount] for [specify]]

(g) [The Defendant has preferred [his/her] own interests over those of other beneficiaries by [specify]]

(h) [The Defendant has failed to invest estate assets prudently, resulting in [specify loss]]

(i) [Further particulars may be provided after disclosure and/or taking of accounts]

### Loss and Damage

10. By reason of the Defendant's breaches, the estate has suffered loss and damage.

**PARTICULARS OF LOSS**

(a) [Loss of estate assets: £[amount]]
(b) [Loss of income/interest: £[amount]]
(c) [Excessive costs incurred: £[amount]]
(d) [Diminution in value of assets: £[amount]]
(e) [Further particulars will be provided after taking of accounts]

### Relief Sought

11. The Claimant seeks:

(1) An order that the Defendant be removed as executor and that [name] be appointed in [his/her] place;

(2) An order that the Defendant account for [his/her] administration of the estate;

(3) An order that the Defendant's accounts be falsified [in respect of [specify]] and/or surcharged [in the sum of £[amount] in respect of [specify]];

(4) An order that the Defendant pay to the estate the sum of £[amount] representing [specify];

(5) [An order that the Defendant be restrained from distributing the estate pending determination of this claim];

(6) Such further or other relief as the Court thinks fit;

(7) Costs on an indemnity basis;

(8) Interest pursuant to section 35A of the Senior Courts Act 1981.

---

## Statement of Truth

**I believe that the facts stated in these Particulars of Claim are true. I understand that proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against anyone who makes, or causes to be made, a false statement in a document verified by a statement of truth without an honest belief in its truth.**

**Signed:** [Signature if signed by party]

[OR: **Signed by solicitor if party unable to sign**]

**[Name of Solicitor]  
[Solicitor for the Claimant]**

**Dated:** [Date]

---

## Drafting Checklist

- [ ] Correct court and heading
- [ ] All parties correctly identified with capacity
- [ ] Background facts clearly pleaded
- [ ] All elements of cause of action pleaded
- [ ] Material facts (not evidence) pleaded
- [ ] Particularity where required (fraud, knowledge, etc.)
- [ ] Loss/damage quantified (if applicable)
- [ ] Relief sought clearly stated
- [ ] Statement of truth included
- [ ] Numbered paragraphs
- [ ] No legal argument (save for submissions)
- [ ] Consistent with client's instructions
- [ ] Supervisor review completed
- [ ] Value indicated if not already issued
